definition: to know/to reprimand/to urge/to long for/to tell/to inform

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: I heard so many people are scared of offending the gods, only consult their own solutions to.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見好多人都話驚得罪神靈，唯有自己諗辦法解決。

sentences.english: Don't dream of reaching success by one step.
sentences.chinese: 要成功不好諗住一步登天。

sentences.english: Thee AIDS epidemic offers an example.
sentences.chinese: 諗艾滋病就是一個例子。

definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
to have or have not/surplus and shortfall/tangible and intangible/corporeal and incorporeal
(literary) to wipe away (tears)/to press with one's fingers/to soak
